pull.title: docs: make it clearer that posix mode must be used in WSL
pull.body: clearly tell to person what select mode

events.message:
Update build-windows.md

clearly tell to person what select mode

events.body:
Are the comments behind each `update-alternatives` instruction, plus the [footnote](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/0811e14cabe279c2f8363c76db06ddd5a0c856ed/doc/build-windows.md#footnotes) not enough?

If you are going to make these changes, you should do it for the `32 bit` instructions as well. 
Also needs a proper commit message (squash any fix-ups into a single commit).

rename.to: docs: make it clearer that posix mode must be used in WSL

events.body:
@fanquake 
as newbie, footnote is not enough get information before click
I think tell what select mode in construction step clearly!
Thanks feedback
@yunchiri If you are going to make the updates, you can reopen and push changes to this Pull Request, you don't have to open a new one.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -77,9 +77,10 @@ The first step is to install the mingw-w64 cross-compilation tool chain:
 
     sudo apt install g++-mingw-w64-x86-64
 
-Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 <sup>[1](#footnote1)</sup>:
+Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 <sup>[1](#footnote1)</sup> (select posix mode):

@@ -77,9 +77,10 @@ The first step is to install the mingw-w64 cross-compilation tool chain:
 
     sudo apt install g++-mingw-w64-x86-64
 
-Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 <sup>[1](#footnote1)</sup>:
+Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 <sup>[1](#footnote1)</sup> (select posix mode): 
 
-    sudo update-alternatives --config x86_64-w64-mingw32-g++ # Set the default mingw32 g++ compiler option to posix.
+    sudo update-alternatives --config x86_64-w64-mingw32-g++ # Set the default mingw32 g++ compiler option to posix
+
